name: Anglia Plus (1 day ranger or 3 in 7 rover)
description:
ANGLIA PLUS Unlimited travel with weekday time restrictions for either one day (Anglia Plus One Day Ranger) or any 3 days  in 7 days (Anglia Plus Three Days in Seven Flexi Rover) in Norfolk 
      and parts of Cambridgeshire and Suffolk within the boundaries of Cambridge, Ely and Ipswich. It includes Norwich, Cromer and Sheringham as well as Great yarmouth and Lowestoft and along the East Suffolk Line between Lowestoft and Ipswich as well as the Felixstowe branch. 
      It is also valid on some local bus services - see the website for details.

fares_and_restrictions.raw: fares & restrictions New fares from 2nd Mar 2025 One day ranger adult: £29.70 child (5-15) unaccomp: £14.85 child (max 4 with adult): £2.00 16-17 saver: £14.85 railcards ⯆ 16 26 SE DI 2T FF H V G : £19.80 Any 3 days in 7 adult: £59.40 child (5-15) unaccomp: £29.70 child (with adult): £4.00 16-17 saver: £29.70 railcards ⯆ 16 26 SE DI 2T FF H V G : £39.60 Railcards ⯈ Railcards: 16 = 16-25 26 = 26-30 SE = Senior DI = Disabled 2T = Two Together FF = Family & Friends H = HM Forces V = Veterans G = Gold Card Previous fares ⯈ Previous fares (adult) One day: 2024 - £28.40 2023 - £26.50 2022 - £25.00 2021 - £24.70 2020 - £24.70 2019 - £24.00 2018 - £19.00 2014 - £17.70 2011 - £15.00 3 in 7 days: 2024 - £56.80 2023 - £53.00 2022 - £50.00 2021 - £49.40 2020 - £49.40 2019 - £48.00 2018 - £38.00 2014 - £35.40 2011 - £30.00 time restrictions Mon to Fri: valid from 08:45 but 2T railcard not valid until 09:30 No restrictions at weekends or bank holidays Also valid on the following: 08:30 Thurston-Ipswich 08:31 Ely-Ipswich 08:33 Norwich-Cambridge 08:36 Norwich-Gt Yarmouth 08:43 Ipswich-Norwich route restrictions Not valid to King's Lynn Not valid to Peterborough Not valid to Sudbury Not valid on CrossCountry Trains train operating companies East Midlands Railway, Great Northern, Greater Anglia, Thameslink purchasing Online: X Train conductor: ✔ * Bus driver: X Station ticket office: ✔ Ticket Vending Machine (TVM): i Northern Ticket Vending Machines now sell most ranger and rover tickets but at the moment only for same-day travel (rather prohibitive for distant areas) Some Avanti West Coast station TVMs for example Crewe, now sell local rangers and rovers. LNER TVMs at Doncaster, Edinburgh, London King's Cross, Newcastle and York also sell them. A number of PTE areas sell local rangers from TVMs in their area e.g. South Yorkshire, Strathclyde and West Midlands * valid ticket to travel is required unless boarded at a station without ticket-issuing facilities
